intro: Rosa montana f. leiostyla, commonly known as the Alpine rose or the mountain rose, is a compact shrub native to the alpine regions of Europe. It features glossy, dark green leaves that are oval in shape and densely arranged along the stems. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is well adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in colder climates.
